summary: "The Exorcist," a 1973 horror film, tells the story of a young girl possessed by a demon and her mother's struggle to save her through an exorcism. Based on William Peter Blatty's novel, the movie was directed by William Friedkin and starred Ellen Burstyn and Linda Blair. Filming was tough with injuries, deaths, and accidents, making people believe the movie was cursed. Despite mixed reviews, it became a huge hit, making $441 million. It was the first horror film nominated for Best Picture at the Oscars and is considered one of the best horror films ever.
title: The Exorcist
